title: 105_hr2640
content: The "Partial Hospitalization Services Integrity Act of 1997" limits the provision of services to locations other than skilled nursing facilities or personal residences. The amendments apply to services provided after the enactment date. The Social Security Act is amended to specify qualifications for community mental health centers, including providing specified mental health services, meeting state licensing requirements, and complying with additional conditions set by the Secretary for safety, efficiency, and compliance. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will ensure re-certification of community mental health centers providing partial hospitalization services under title XVIII of the Social Security Act to comply with regulations. The first re-certification must be done within a year of the enactment of the Act. Additionally, a prospective payment system for partial hospitalization services will be implemented. The Secretary may establish a prospective payment system for partial hospitalization services provided by community mental health centers or hospitals to outpatients. The system will ensure appropriate payment levels for efficient centers and consider payment levels for similar services by other entities. The text discusses the establishment of a prospective payment system for partial hospitalization services provided by community mental health centers or hospitals to outpatients. It includes details on the total aggregate payments and coinsurance adjustments under the system. The amendment to U.S.C. 1395k(a)(2) includes changes to subparagraphs (B) and (J), while the amendment to Section 1833(a) of the Act involves adjustments to paragraphs (2), (8), (9), and the addition of a new paragraph (10) regarding partial hospitalization services payment basis. The amendments made by subsections (b) and (c) apply to services furnished on or after January 1 of the first year that begins at least 6 months after the date on which regulations are issued under section 1833(p) of the Act. SEC. 6. DEMONSTRATION FOR IMPROVED PARTIAL HOSPITALIZATION SERVICES. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is implementing a demonstration project under part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act for community mental health centers to offer expanded partial hospitalization services. These services include outpatient mental health services and other appropriate mental health services to provide a full continuum of ambulatory behavioral health care services. The Secretary will select community mental health centers in 3 different States for a project offering expanded partial hospitalization services on a capitated payment basis. The Secretary has the authority to waive provisions of the Social Security Act for this project and will evaluate its impact on beneficiary health and Medicare program savings. The Secretary will evaluate the impact of capitated payments for expanded partial hospitalization services on Medicare program savings, utilization of inpatient services, and associated costs. A report with findings, conclusions, and recommendations for legislation will be submitted to Congress within 4 years. The project will provide additional mental health services through community mental health centers on a capitated basis for a 3-year period.
